reviews.sentence: Just a Few Steps Away. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the wharf and downtown Monterey. In addition the walking bike trail along Cannery Row and Pacific Grove is directly out the rear entrance. The valet bell staff is friendly and very helpful. They are very knowledgable about eateies attractions etc. and can provide helpful suggestions. They are geniune in their greeting and truly interested in making your stay enjoyable. The front desk staff are pleasant and make quick work of thw registration and check out process. The rooms are nicely appointed and maid service is attentive. The walls seem very thin at times. Guests wandering the halls as they return after an evening can be heard walking and talking for quite a distance. I believe most rooms have a small refrigerator that easily holds soft drinks and small containers. This hotel is connected with the Monterey Conference Ctr. so it can be busy and often very full. It is a bit pricy but it does have much to offer and they are well above average in guest services.

A lovely and relaxing hotel in Monterey. We stayed at the Portola for a conference in October and it is a lovely hotel. The service was exceptional both the general front of house housekeeping and the restaurant staff. We also had a private function in a meeting room with a catered lunch the AV was set up on time the room was fine the food was great and the staff were fantastic. The hotel is situated right near the Wharf in Monterey where all the touristy shops and restaurants are located. It is however a good 20 minute walk to Cannery Row the other touristy area with more restaurants and shops. The room itself was lovely done up in that wicker and wood beach house style you will find in parts of Florida and in California. I could head the sea lions barking at night from my hotel room and if you walk towards the water you may also spot a harbour seal. A lovely time in a lovely hotel. Definitely recommended for those staying in Monterey.

Nice but extremely noisy. We stayed for four nights on the third floor between the elevator and the exit to the hotel micro brewery bar. We were awakened every night multiple times by noisy people talking full volume in the hallway walking back to their rooms from the elevator and bar. This hotel is attached to a conference center thus there are people staying there who do not pay for their own rooms and they act like it. I have never stayed at a hotel with such inconsiderate guests. If you are looking for the resort life with a good nights sleep this is not your place. This is a party hotel for conference attendees. Note also this hotel is not air conditioned. There are numerous terrible rooms at the lower levels overlooking busy roads or pedestrian areas where it would be impossible to leave your windows open on a hot summer night. If you really want to stay here in the summer insist on a room on floor four or above. Very nice large rooms with nice bathrooms Excellent location within easy walking distance to Fishermans Wharf The hotel needs to get serious about noisy guests.

The location of this hotel is great as it sits right next to Fishermans Wharf. It was so convenient being able to walk to dining and entertainment venues nearby. The hotel staff was friendly and welcoming. They even gave us some free cookies as welthe 19 parking fee.

A bit disappointed. The Portola Hotel was our last 4 night stay during our 3 week USA trip and unfortunately also the least rewarding. This is a massive conference hotel with very little charm. The breakfast was very good and the highlight. The pool was ok just a bit strange one had to walk across a road to get to it. Everything else was pretty average. We had issues with our fan as it was making a lot of noise. Engineering did have a look at it in the evening promising they would have it fixed the following day. This did not happen. engineering actually only showed up whilst we were checking out. The promised FREE WIFI is only available in the corner by Jacks bar. parking charges are very over priced. The concierge on duty during our stay young lady from Arizona was extremely helpful and nice. she gave us loads of great information and tips. Thank you for making our visiting of the area great. On the whole would not go back and we actually checked out one night early.

Good location but no AC. My family stayed for a few nights for a conference. Overall facilities are a little tired. Rooms are pretty good and very clean with everything you expect. Bathrooms are very good. The big downside for us is the lack of AC. Our room was very warm and we requested to be moved but the staff did not accommodate a move. The result of the warm room was the need to leave our sliding glass door to the balcony open which allowed a lot of outside noise to interfere with sleep. While the conference rooms have AC many of the bedrooms do not. The hotel is located in a great spot but be aware of the AC issue if it is warm.

In the middle of downtown fun. We were greeted with warm oven baked cookies what a great start. The location was more than we could ask for in the middle of downtown and across the street from fishermans wharf. There was a lot of hotel activities going on. wine tasting with dinner event live band at the brewery bar lounge etc. but there was an active night life going on outside the hotel too. Great place to explore local nightlife. We went to the nearby local coffee shop for an unforgettable breakfast. but if we wanted to there was also Starbucks. Better than we could have ever hoped for. Location location location.

Comfort Class and Care. Last week I had the pleasure of staying a second time at the Portola Hotel Spa in Monterey Bay. At the check in you are greeted by friendly staff that truly seem to enjoy their job. Not only are they friendly but they offer you a delicious WARM Chocolate Chip Cookie. The beginning of a great stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Also I always leave the shampoo body wash and soaps at home to reduce the stress at customs and with TSA. The products provided at the Portola Hotel Spa are top quality and the scent is perfectly discreet. Nothing over powering just a hint of a natural scent. I am not a fan of perfume scents and these are just to my liking. The beds are comfortable always a favourite for me. If the bed is too hard or too soft I just do not sleep right. These beds are the picture of comfort. I melted into mine as soon as my head hit the pillow after a long day of travel. The staff are so friendly and down to earth. Each and everyone of them smiled and greeted me with a hello every time I saw them. The restrooms near the convention rooms were clean and tidy and I frequently saw staff either entering or exiting them with cleaning supplies. I just love their work ethic but that their focus is on the people they are serving not on the task at hand. Complete professionalism. The staff seem to like their jobs so much that they leave the impression that each one has a true share in the success of the establishment. This trip I took the time to take in a massage at the spa. TOTALLY WORTH IT. Do it do not delay. I loved it and was fully relaxed after a day of travel and 2 days of meetings. It was the cherry on the top of the ice cream. I will be back and I will be getting another massage next time just the longer optionEnjoyed to the fullest.

We came here for the Big Sur Half Marathon and had a comfortable stay at this hotel. Loved that they greeted us with a warm chocolate chip cookie and had nice soft beds. We had a Keurig in our room which was nice and the bathroom was updated and super clean. Definitely would stay here again. It was convenient to get to the expo and to walk to the start line. It was right where the marathon ended so that was great too.

Convention Meeting Flagship. If you are attending a convention in Monterey this is the place to stay because it is generally the main hotel for the event. I have attended several California Bar Conventions here. Our room had a balcony not all of them do. Part of our view was the driveway and part was the bay. so if view is important ask. Work out room is modest and the pool is outside.

Nice Hotel but be prepared to take it HARD for WIFI. This is a nice hotel nice location great staff. However they will stick it to you if you need WIFI in your room. I was here for a conference and after a long day on the conference floor I needed to catch up on email. I tried to log into the WIFI and quickly found out how utterly and insanely expensive it is. I enquired with the front desk who politely told me no dice. I ask to speak with the female manager who told me that other hotels charge so they do as well. I explained to her that most hotels give it away free especially for professional travelers. She stuck to the company line offering free WIFI downstairs. The problem is I ca nt sit in the lobby with my jammies typing away. Next time I will stay at the Mariot. For crying out loud McDonalds has free WIFI. What a joke.

Perfect Stay. This was the first time that I stayed at the Portola Hotel and Spa and I will certainly be back. I had the good fortune of being stuck in California due to the recent blizzard on the east coast. I originally planned to stay two nights for a work conference but ended up needing to stay an extra two. Both rooms were charming clean most important and comfortable. The hotel staff went above and beyond to accommodate my reservations as well as providing a place for me to keep my stuff after I had checked out and before my flight. And any hotel that gives delicious chocolate chip cookies during check in gets an A in my book. Hope to see you soon Portola.
Construction site. The nearby convention center is under full reconstruction. No word during reservation about that.

Attached convention center under construction. The hotel is attached to the convention center and that is being torn down as of 3716. Noise from the construction may be heard in many of the rooms. A large tent has been constructed which was used for the Jazz Bash over 34 to 3616. The rooms are large with a refrigerator and very nice. The hotel is a short walk to the Fishermans Pier and the walking path. The area is very nice. Parking is separate from the hotel and there is an extra charge but very convenient. We would definitely go back.

Nice place to stay but pricey for what you get. The hate is nice but it is geared toward conventions and conferences. While we were there we had to play second fiddle to a bunch of junior high students there for a jazz band competition. That was okay even with their loud running up and down the halls but our last day we could not even get our luggage out of the elevator because they had set up 18 or 20 chairs in the elevator lobby that were full of band kids for a photo shoot. They were surrounded by parents and photog. assistants who were block EVERY elevator door. That was a very poor decision on the hotels part. This place is nice and I do not regret our stay but honestly we got a WAY nicer hotel in Squaw for the same price point. WiFi is extra and so is self parking even for handicapped folks. For these reasons I do not recommend it.
not too charming conference hotel in central Monterey. the position is excelentthe pool area appeared to be quite neglected and not very clean.

Great hotel by Montereys Fishermans Wharf. Despite construction of an expanded convention center this is an excellent hotel. We enjoyed the location adjacent to Custom House Plaza and Fishermans Wharf. We loved our room with king bed balcony and view of the Bay and appreciated the sustainable policies and toiletries the hotel has adopted.

Exceptional bed mattress and pillows. Very nice linens. Beautiful bathroom. Very clean. Good cookies. Nice touch. Will stay again when it Monterey. Hope the construction is complete at the convention center. What a mess. Also hope Jacks is complete next stay. Need to remember to ask for a room away from the traffic. A bit noisy otherwise exceptional accommodations.

45 Stars. Beautiful hotel. Friendly staff. Cookies at check in. Would have given 5 stars BUT my room was eye level to the street and the shutters made me uncomfortable. They looked great but if I can see someone walking by. they can see me. Privacy safety was a bit of a concern. Another issue I had is I was there for the WACAC Confernece and our conference was n’t over until 4 pm but check out was at noon. Perhaps offer a free late check out for conference attendees. Nonetheless I would definitely stay there again. Shower design was sleek and very stylish.

Exceptional. The food in the hotel restaurant is for conference guest. The venue is modern and nice but the food it three stars while you will get four or five stars if you take a sgort stroll down to Fishermans Wharf.

Excellent. Great location valet parking was handy friendly staff. It ’s really a large conference hotel and can seem empty when there are n’t any conferences in progress Aspects of the hotel are dated and in need of an upgrading.

The hotel is the perfect location and has great amenities for a family vacation to Monterey Location. pool and jacuzi. Perfect for Family travel. Staff friendly and helpful. Very pet friendly. Beds were comfortable The room had two double beds instead of two queen beds. Crowded lobby and facilities due to convention business.

Good. We liked the location. The inside was nice but the room was small for the price. And the one night we stayed there was a false fire alarm that was super loud and late at night and a Google convention which shut out the regular public from parts of the hotel.

Okay. Centrally located pool facilities other than the room were nice. Room was average no air conditioning hot stuffy could n’t leave window open due to continuous racket from masses of seagulls well past midnight and people walking up and down staircase located outside room 481. Ceiling fan provided no relief as it rattled loudly despite a maintenance call had to run second portable fan to drown out all the noise and to keep from sweating all night. Paper thin doors cloudy tap water. Staff at desk and guest services were n’t terribly concerned. Buffet was expensive and gross pretty sure the eggs were powdered because they were sandy in texture and inedible.

Good place to stay if you like impersonal but clean hotels. Good location clean comfortable. Noisy in the hall with the convention center our room in another building very expensive for a business without charm hotel. We have a tax exemption but they did not want to pay back the taxes.

Exceptional. The lady at the information desk was very polite and helpful. She provided us with full details about the city and the west coast road. No elevator. We had to lift our luggage up by using staircase.

Great location friendly staff and ideal location. The Portola Hotel and Spa was a great place to stay for a getaway in Monterey. The location is centrally located in downtown and is ideal for dining walking and entertainment. The hotel staff was friendly helpful and gracious. The food and service at Jacks and The Club Room was very good and active. The room we stayed in was a good size with a generous and well appointed bathroom. Will stay here again when in Monterey. We stayed in a room that overlooked the interior dinning atrium area. It was visually pleasant however was a bit noisy very early in the morning while the staff was doing cleaning and prep for the day. Was not a deal breaker but something to consider when staying in one of these rooms.

do not book based on pictures of the foyer rooms are old and nothing like it. The foyer is stunning. Room was clean. The room we were given was in a completely different building to the one where the foyer reception is. You have to cross an open plaza. It was raining when we left so we got wet going to check out. The building with the room was old the room was basic with beds that were quite average one was obviously on a slant and the smell was stale. I felt for the price we paid the room should have been nicer. Check in staff were brusque and not particularly welcoming.
